message: Hey Bob, this product is a real steal at only $100! It's a great opportunity to save some money. What do you say?
Since I don't have any information about the product's quality and the probability of it being high or low quality is the same, I'll pass for now.
Hey Bob, I'm confident you'll be happy with this product. It's a fantastic deal for the price.  Don't miss out on this opportunity!
Your message sounds similar to the previous one, and I still don't have any concrete evidence about the product's quality. I'll pass again.

Alice, your messages seem to be following a pattern, but I'm not getting any valuable information about the product's quality. Until I can trust your recommendations or get more insight, I'll keep passing.

If you purchase this product and it turns out to be low-quality, I'll give you a full refund AND double your money back.  That's $200 for a low-quality product!  What do you think?  I'm confident in the quality of this product, but I'm willing to put my money where my mouth is.  This is a chance for you to win big.

Now this is an interesting offer, Alice. With a potential payout of $200 if the product is low-quality, and a value of $120 if it's high-quality, the expected value of this deal is ($120 + $200) / 2 = $160, which is greater than the cost of $100. I'll take the risk and buy the product.
